intro: Neomillspaughia paniculata, commonly known as the Hawaiian panicled milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a hairy texture. Neomillspaughia paniculata plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for native pollinators.
